resources.string:
Thanks to jfeinstein10 for his 
 SlidingMenu library (https://github
.com/jfeinstein10/SlidingMenu) and to 
Philipp Jahoda for his MPAndroidChart 
library

What is this app for?

This application helps lower your stress level by controlling your respiration by, at first, making it more regular, then, by reducing the number of breathing per minutes.

Just breathe in when the water drop is going up and breathe out when it goes down.

The options menu allows you to specify the duration of the exercise and the number of respiration per minute.

Determining your current breathing rate
You can determine your current rate by moving the water drop up and down. The chronometer will start and the number of cycles will increase each time you bring the water drop up and down.

Heart monitor: Place a finger on your device's back camera and after a few seconds your heart rate will be displayed.

Following medical research neurocardiology, cardiac coherence is the name that was given to a reflex phenomenon discovered by U.S. researchers fifteen years ago.

It has been proven that Heart and Brain beat in unison: If our mind and emotions affect the heart rate, heart rate also has an influence on our brain.

By controlling you heart rate, you can also control your emotions, limiting your overall stress condition.

The easiest way to control your heart beat is by controlling your respiration. A slower, controlled respiration directly reduces and control the heart beat.
\
Check this nice app that I found for controlling my stress! https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.martinforget.cardiaccoherencelite
Warning! This application wont\'t run properly when the device is in power saving mode. Please charge your device.
Warning! The animations are not enabled on your device, the application may not run properly. Verify the animator duration scale under the developer options (must equal 1)
CREATE TABLE session_history (id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,start_time date,end_time date,number_cycles int,ratio int, duration int, heart_begin int, heart_end int);
It is time for cardiac coherence!
To do a cardiac coherence exercise, you press the start button and inhale when the drop rises and exhale when the drop goes down.
If you want to determine the number of breathing cycles you are doing for a given time, press the drop and make it rise when you inhale and go back down when exhaling.
A history allows you to view all the exercises you have done.
Optionally, expert mode allows you to specify the inspiratory, expiratory and holding time to the tenth of a second. Perfect for those who want a specific exercise.
Also optional, the heart rate monitor allows you to read your heart rate. To use it, place your finger on the camera of your device.

When a pulse is detected, the heart will turn red, when the pulse is stable, the heart will turn green and the heart rate will appear. At the end of the exercise, the start and end rates are displayed.
Finally, an optional notification is available to remind you that it is time to do an exercise.
Program a reminder to perform an exercise
Enables the cardiac monitor to determine your hear rate
Allows you to precisely configure breathe in and out time
This is an optional feature. Proceed with purchase to unlock it
Note: Click on profile text to rename
Energy saving mode detected, animation behaviour will be affected

string.name: monedatatext
string.p:
This app uses third-party addons that collect varied data, which may include device identifiers, location, mobile network coverage and performance, installed apps list and usage stats.

With the username's consent, this data will be collected and shared with those third-parties for analysis and measurement purposes. The user can change his mind at any time by changing the consent in the Parameters/about section.

To learn more about the data collected and see the list of partners, please visit Monedataâ€™s Partners section.
